content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <!DOCTYPE metadata SYSTEM "http://www.fgdc.gov/metadata/fgdc-std-001-1998.dtd"[]> <metadata>   <idinfo>     <citation>       <citeinfo>         <origin>EFS GeoTechnologies</origin>         <pubdate>20100816</pubdate>         <title>2010 Perry County Half Foot Orthos</title>         <geoform>remote-sensing image</geoform>         <onlink>http://www.geostor.arkansas.gov/G6/Home.html?id=50d9cb6509c45923954ccc05204a30af</onlink>         <onlink>ftp://ftp.geostor.arkansas.gov/geostor_raster_02/2010/PerryCounty/HalfFoot</onlink>         <pubinfo>           <publish>County, Perry</publish>         </pubinfo>       </citeinfo>     </citation>     <descript>       <abstract>An orthoimage is remotely sensed image data in which displacement of features in the image caused by terrain relief and sensor orientation have been mathematically removed.  Orthoimagery combines the image characteristics of a photograph with the geometric qualities of a map. For this dataset, the true color orthoimages were produced at Half Foot GSD.</abstract>       <purpose>Provide high resolution digital orthoimagery to be used by Perry County officials and employees in day to day operations of the county government.</purpose>     </descript>     <timeperd>       <timeinfo>         <sngdate>         </sngdate>       </timeinfo>       <current>ground condition</current>     </timeperd>     <status>       <progress>Complete</progress>       <update>None planned</update>     </status>     <spdom>       <bounding>         <westbc> -92.938731</westbc> <secinfo>       <secclass>Unclassified</secclass>     </secinfo>     <natvform>File Transfer Protocol</natvform>   </idinfo>   <dataqual>     <attracc>       <attraccr>Atmospheric conditions and time of day affect image appearance.  To minimize image-to-image difference tonal balancing was performed on all images.</attraccr>       <qattracc>         <attraccv>3</attraccv>       </qattracc>     </attracc>     <posacc>       <horizpa>         <horizpar>Orthorectification techniques were used to generate exterior orientation for each image.  Nearest operational CORS station was used for post-processing GPS/IMU data.  Ground control is not available to test horizontal accuracy.</horizpar>       </horizpa>     </posacc>     <lineage>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>EFS GeoTechnologies</origin>             <pubdate>August 16, 2010</pubdate>             <title>Ortho Imagery</title>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <typesrc>Digital File</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>August 16, 2010</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>ground condition</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>Imagery</srccitea>       </srcinfo>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>EFS GeoTechnologies</origin>             <title>External Orientation</title>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <srcscale>Not Applicable</srcscale>         <typesrc>Digital File</typesrc>         <srctime>           <timeinfo>             <sngdate>               <caldate>August 16, 2010</caldate>             </sngdate>           </timeinfo>           <srccurr>publication date</srccurr>         </srctime>         <srccitea>EO</srccitea>         <srccontr>The coupled GPS/IMU provides camera position information called exterior orientation (EO).  The EO parameters contain x, y, z, roll, pitch, yaw for each camera exposure.  The values are used to perform direct georeferencing without the need for performing aerial triangulation.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>USGS</origin>             <title>Digital Elevation Model</title>           </citeinfo>         </srccite>         <srcscale>1:24000</srcscale>         <typesrc>Digital File-Internet Download</typesrc>         <srccitea>Digital Elevation Model (DEM)</srccitea>         <srccontr>USGS 10-meter DEM,provided by USGS seamless distribution center, were used to provide vertical control for the orthophoto production.  The DEM is used to remove the effect of terrain from the aerial photos.</srccontr>       </srcinfo>       <srcinfo>         <srccite>           <citeinfo>             <origin>Applanix</origin> This data has been developed from the best available sources. Although efforts have been made to ensure that the data is accurate and reliable, errors and variable conditions originating from physical sources used to develop the data may be reflected in the data supplied. Users must be aware of these conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, scale, resolution, rectification, positional accuracy, development methodology, time period, environmental and climatic conditions and other circumstances specific to this data. The user is responsible for understanding the accuracy limitations of the data provided herein. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. The user should refer to the accompanying metadata notes for a description of the data and data development procedures.
